abstract: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether receiver is considered to be “like” a given string when the case of characters in the receiver is ignored.
overview:
## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/YES] if the receiver is considered to be “like” `aString` when the case of characters in the receiver is ignored, otherwise [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NO].

## Discussion

Currently, [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NSObject-swift.class/isCaseInsensitiveLike(_:)] messages are never sent to any object from within Cocoa itself.

The default implementation for this method provided by `NSObject` returns [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NO]. `NSString` also provides an implementation of this method, which returns [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/YES] if the receiver matches a pattern described by `aString`, ignoring the case of the characters in the receiver.

# isCaseInsensitiveLike(_:)

**Instance Method**

Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether receiver is considered to be “like” a given string when the case of characters in the receiver is ignored.

## Declaration

```swift
func isCaseInsensitiveLike(_ object: String) -> Bool
```

## Parameters

- **object**: The string with which to compare the receiver.

## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/YES] if the receiver is considered to be “like” `aString` when the case of characters in the receiver is ignored, otherwise [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NO].

## Discussion

Currently, [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NSObject-swift.class/isCaseInsensitiveLike(_:)] messages are never sent to any object from within Cocoa itself.

The default implementation for this method provided by `NSObject` returns [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NO]. `NSString` also provides an implementation of this method, which returns [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/YES] if the receiver matches a pattern described by `aString`, ignoring the case of the characters in the receiver.
title: isCaseInsensitiveLike(_:)
